q_en: List the raw materials and quantities used for orders in June 2024? And organize it into the form of {raw materials: used quantity}.

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE created_at BETWEEN '2024-06-01' AND '2024-06-30';
steps.description: Retrieve the order IDs for orders created in June 2024

steps.sql: SELECT order_product.product_id, order_product.number FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN (10, 11, 12);
steps.description: Retrieve the product IDs and quantities for each order in June 2024

steps.sql: SELECT product_material.material_id, product_material.number FROM product_material WHERE product_id IN (30, 20, 7);
steps.description: Retrieve the raw material IDs and required quantities for each product

steps.sql: SELECT materials.name, SUM(product_material.number * order_product.number) AS used_quantity FROM product_material JOIN materials ON product_material.material_id = materials.id JOIN order_product ON product_material.product_id = order_product.product_id WHERE order_product.order_id IN (10, 11, 12) GROUP BY product_material.material_id;
steps.description: Calculate the total used quantity for each raw material

response:
Sure thing! Let's take a look at the raw materials and quantities used for orders in June 2024. Here's a neat table to show you the details:

| Raw Material              | Used Quantity |
|---------------------------|---------------|
| Fabric Pieces             | 1110          |
| Silk Pieces               | 1140          |
| Synthetic Fiber Pieces    | 150           |
| Denim Fabric Pieces       | 1650          |

I hope this helps! If you have any more questions, feel free to ask. ğŸ˜Š
